title: AVX related build errors in ATen when using gcc 5.5 on ubuntu 16.04
body_html:
I was building a docker image which builds aten as well. ATen failed to build because of errors like

usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5/include/avx512vlintrin.h(11280): error: argument of type "void *" is incompatible with parameter of type "long long *"

This happens when using gcc 5.5 (which ubuntu toolchain ships as default now). It seems to be a gcc bug tensorflow/tensorflow#10220 (comment)

filing the issue here so that when pytorch docker images are upgraded on CI, this can be tracked and addressed (if needed).

cc @cpuhrsch

body:
I was building a docker image which builds aten as well. ATen failed to build because of errors like 

```
usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5/include/avx512vlintrin.h(11280): error: argument of type "void *" is incompatible with parameter of type "long long *"
```

This happens when using gcc 5.5 (which ubuntu toolchain ships as default now). It seems to be a gcc bug https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/10220#issuecomment-352110064 

filing the issue here so that when pytorch docker images are upgraded on CI, this can be tracked and addressed (if needed).

cc @cpuhrsch
